body:
Hello @aqurilla! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/generic.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/pandas/core/generic.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/base.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/pandas/core/indexes/base.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/multi.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/pandas/core/indexes/multi.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/series.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/pandas/core/series.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/io/stata.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/pandas/io/stata.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`scripts/tests/test_validate_docstrings.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/scripts/tests/test_validate_docstrings.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`scripts/validate_docstrings.py`](https://github.com/aqurilla/pandas/blob/3950b3c9f76ed18b225ff90e4444f38c95b8c539/scripts/validate_docstrings.py) !

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24188?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24188?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [77278ba...3950b3c](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24188?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

> * [x]  closes #24143
> * [ ]  tests added / passed
> * [ ]  passes `git diff upstream/master -u -- "*.py" | flake8 --diff`
> * [ ]  whatsnew entry
> 
> Two methods still show errors due to their docstrings being generated by the [deprecate](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/v0.23.4/pandas/util/_decorators.py#L10) method in _decorators.py. I am not sure if that is to be changed.

The failing check is due to these two methods mentioned above - `pandas.Series.argmax` and `pandas.Series.argmin` whose docstrings are generated by `_decorators.py`. What would be the best way to resolve these?
@jreback can `Series.argmin` and `Series.argmax`, deprecated in `0.21.0` be removed for `0.24.0`? Or arent' we removing deprecated stuff until `1.0`?
@aqurilla I created #24215 which will fix the errors caused by `argmin` and `argmax`. Once it's merged, if you merge master into your branch, it should pass the CI.
Also, @aqurilla if you can merge master into your branch, the PR that fixed `argmin` and `argmax` has been merged, and the CI should be green now.

Thanks for the fixes @aqurilla 

@WillAyd, feel free to open a PR to merge the deprecate methods you mentioned. I think that'll make easier to understand what you meant, than discussing in comments.
